parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Flags </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets flag owner. When owner is set to [[objNull]] or any object other than a unit of class [[Models_%26_Classnames:_CfgVehicles_-_Class_Man|man]] or [[Game_Logic|logic]], flag is returned to the flagpole. A flag owned by a logic has no visual representation.</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> flag '''setFlagOwner''' owner </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> flag: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> owner: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_flag1 [[setFlagOwner]] _soldier1;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> To return the flag back to the flag pole:<code>//Method 1: (set owner null)
[[flag]] _flagCarrier [[setFlagOwner]] [[objNull]];
//Method 2: (set the flag mast as the owner)
[[flag]] _flagCarrier [[setFlagOwner]] [[flag]] _flagCarrier;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[flag]], [[flagOwner]], [[setFlagSide]], [[setFlagTexture]], [[flagSide]], [[flagTexture]], [[forceFlagTexture]], [[getForcedFlagTexture]], [[Flag Textures]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dt class="note">[[User:Bdfy|Bdfy]]
<dd class="note">
Since flags can not be owned by vehicles, use ''"flag setFlagOwner driver tank1"'' or ''"flag1 setFlagOwner tank1D"'' to assign the flag to the vehicle's driver. The second method will only work if ''tank1'' is the name of a unit, not a variable refering to it. True for OFP&Arma

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment>
</dl>
